meanings.definition: A sticky substance used to adhere objects together.
meanings.sent1: I used stickum to glue the pieces of paper together.
meanings.sent2: The stickum on the tape helped the poster stay on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The stickum made the craft project extra messy but fun.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a stickum-like effect, making everyone pay attention.
meanings.sent5: The stickum was so strong, it felt like magic holding things in place.

meanings.definition: The act of sticking or adhering.
meanings.sent1: The stickum of the tape made it hard to remove from the table.
meanings.sent2: His stickum to the rules impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The stickum of the gum caused a funny situation at the party.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had a stickum that nothing could break.
meanings.sent5: The stickum of the situation made it hard to move forward.
